metadata.title: CVE-2018-5093 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow vulnerability may occur in WebAssembly duringMemory/Table resizing, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
